Annotation.String: The `PCIeDevice` schema describes the properties of a PCIe device that is attached to a system. It also describes the location, such as a slot, socket, or bay, where a unit can be installed, by populating a resource instance with an absent state if a unit is not present.

This resource shall represent a PCIe device in a Redfish implementation. It may also represent a location, such as a slot, socket, or bay, where a unit may be installed, but the `State` property within the `Status` property contains `Absent`.
This type describes a PCIe Interface.
This type shall describe the PCIe interface characteristics of a PCIe device.
The PCIe errors associated with this device.
This property shall contain properties that describe the PCIe errors associated with this device.
A PCIe v1.0 slot.
A PCIe v2.0 slot.
A PCIe v3.0 slot.
A PCIe v4.0 slot.
A PCIe v5.0 slot.
A PCIe v6.0 slot.
The manufacturer of this PCIe device.

This property shall contain the name of the organization responsible for producing the PCIe device. This organization may be the entity from whom the PCIe device is purchased, but this is not necessarily true.
The model number for the PCIe device.
This property shall contain the name by which the manufacturer generally refers to the PCIe device.
The SKU for this PCIe device.
This property shall contain the stock-keeping unit number for this PCIe device.
The serial number for this PCIe device.
This property shall contain a manufacturer-allocated number that identifies the PCIe device.
The part number for this PCIe device.
This property shall contain a part number assigned by the organization that is responsible for producing or manufacturing the PCIe device.
The user-assigned asset tag for this PCIe device.
This property shall contain an identifying string that tracks the PCIe device for inventory purposes.
The device type for this PCIe device.
This property shall contain the device type of the PCIe device such as `SingleFunction` or `MultiFunction`.
The version of firmware for this PCIe device.
This property shall contain the firmware version of the PCIe device.
The status and health of the resource and its subordinate or dependent resources.
This property shall contain any status or health properties of the resource.
The links to other resources that are related to this resource.
This property shall contain links to resources that are related to but are not contained by, or subordinate to, this resource.
The links to other resources that are related to this resource.
This Redfish Specification-described type shall contain links to resources that are related to but are not contained by, or subordinate to, this resource.
An array of links to the chassis in which the PCIe device is contained.
This property shall contain an array of links to resources of type `Chassis` that represent the physical containers associated with this resource.
An array of links to PCIe functions exposed by this device.
This property shall contain an array of links to resources of type `PCIeFunction` that represent the PCIe functions this device exposes.

PropertyValue.String: This property has been deprecated in favor of the `PCIeFunctions` property in the root that provides a link to a resource collection.

Annotation.String: A single-function PCIe device.
A multi-function PCIe device.
A PCIe device that is not currently physically present, but is being simulated by the PCIe infrastructure.
A PCIe retimer device.
This version was created to show that annotations in previous namespaces were updated.

This version was created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that OData properties are marked as required, and integer properties are marked as integer rather than number.
This version was created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that URI properties use the uri-reference format.
This version was created to update descriptions that this schema defines.
This version was created to correct various descriptions to use proper normative terminology.
This version was created to update the schema descriptions to mention its applicability to physical locations as an absent resource.
This version was created to force the regeneration of OpenAPI schemas to properly express nullable properties with external references. It was also created to correct various typographical errors.
The available actions for this resource.
This property shall contain the available actions for this resource.
The available actions for this resource.
This type shall contain the available actions for this resource.
The available OEM-specific actions for this resource.
This property shall contain the available OEM-specific actions for this resource.
The available OEM-specific actions for this resource.
This type shall contain the available OEM-specific actions for this resource.

The link to the assembly associated with this PCIe device.
This property shall contain a link to a resource of type `Assembly`.

The PCIe interface details for this PCIe device.
This property shall contain details for the PCIe interface that connects this PCIe device to its host or upstream switch.
Properties that describe a PCIe interface.
This type shall contain the definition for a PCIe interface for a Redfish implementation.
The OEM extension property.
This property shall contain the OEM extensions. All values for properties contained in this object shall conform to the Redfish Specification-described requirements.
The highest version of the PCIe specification supported by this device.
This property shall contain the maximum PCIe specification that this device supports.
The version of the PCIe specification in use by this device.
This property shall contain the negotiated PCIe interface version in use by this device.
The number of PCIe lanes supported by this device.
This property shall contain the maximum number of PCIe lanes supported by this device.
The number of PCIe lanes in use by this device.
This property shall contain the number of PCIe lanes in use by this device, which shall be equal to or less than the `MaxLanes` property value.
This version was created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that URI properties use the uri-reference format, and to add a missing term to `PCIeInterface` to disallow it from being `null`.

This version was created to deprecate `PCIeFunctions` in `Links` in favor of the new `PCIeFunctions` at the root of the resource.
The link to the collection of PCIe functions associated with this PCIe device.
This property shall contain a link to a resource collection of type `PCIeFunctionCollection`. This property should not be present if `DeviceType` contains `Retimer`.

The UUID for this PCIe device.
This property shall contain the universally unique identifier number for this PCIe device.

The spare part number of the PCIe device.
This property shall contain the spare part number of the PCIe device.

This version was created to update the schema descriptions to mention its applicability to physical locations as an absent resource.

An indication of whether the PCIe device is prepared by the system for removal.

This property shall indicate whether the PCIe device is ready for removal. Setting the value to `true` shall cause the service to perform appropriate actions to quiesce the device. A task may spawn while the device is quiescing.
The link to the environment metrics for this PCIe device.
This property shall contain a link to a resource of type `EnvironmentMetrics` that specifies the environment metrics for this PCIe device.
This version was created to update the schema descriptions to mention its applicability to physical locations as an absent resource.
This version was created to correct various typographical errors.
This version was created to force the regeneration of OpenAPI schemas to properly express nullable properties with external references. It was also created to correct various typographical errors.
The total number of PCIe correctable errors for this device.
This property shall contain the total number of PCIe correctable errors for this device.
The total number of PCIe non-fatal errors for this device.
This property shall contain the total number of PCIe non-fatal errors for this device.
The total number of PCIe fatal errors for this device.
This property shall contain the total number of PCIe fatal errors for this device.
The total number of times the PCIe link states transitioned from L0 to the recovery state for this device.
This property shall contain the total number of times the PCIe link transitioned from L0 to the recovery state for this device.
The total number of PCIe replays issued by this device.

This property shall contain the total number of replays issued on the PCIe link by this device. A replay is a retransmission of a TLP and occurs because the ACK timer is expired, which means that the receiver did not send the ACK or this device did not properly decode the ACK.
The total number of PCIe replay rollovers issued by this device.

This property shall contain the total number of replay rollovers issued on the PCIe link by this device. A replay rollover occurs when consecutive replays failed to resolve the errors on the link, which means that this device forced the link into the recovery state.
The total number of NAKs issued on the PCIe link by this device.

This property shall contain the total number of NAKs issued on the PCIe link by this device. A NAK is issued by the device when it detects that a TLP from the receiver was missed. This could be because the receiver did not transmit it, or because this device could not properly decode the packet.
The total number of NAKs issued on the PCIe link by the receiver.

This property shall contain the total number of NAKs issued on the PCIe link by the receiver. A NAK is issued by the receiver when it detects that a TLP from this device was missed. This could be because this device did not transmit it, or because the receiver could not properly decode the packet.
This version was created to update the schema descriptions to mention its applicability to physical locations as an absent resource.
This version was created to correct various typographical errors.
This version was created to force the regeneration of OpenAPI schemas to properly express nullable properties with external references. It was also created to correct various typographical errors.
Information about the slot for this PCIe device.
This property shall contain information about the PCIe slot for this PCIe device.
The PCIe slot associated with a PCIe device.
This object shall contain properties that describe the PCIe slot associated with a PCIe device.
The PCIe specification this slot supports.
This property shall contain the maximum PCIe specification that this slot supports.
The PCIe slot type.
This property shall contain the PCIe slot type.
The number of PCIe lanes supported by this slot.
This property shall contain the maximum number of PCIe lanes supported by the slot.
The location of the PCIe slot.
This property shall contain part location information, including a `ServiceLabel` property, of the associated PCIe slot.
The lane splitting strategy used in the PCIe slot.
This property shall contain lane splitting information of the associated PCIe slot.
Full-Length PCIe slot.
Half-Length PCIe slot.
Low-Profile or Slim PCIe slot.
Mini PCIe slot.
PCIe M.2 slot.
An OEM-specific slot.
Open Compute Project 3.0 small form factor slot.
Open Compute Project 3.0 large form factor slot.
U.2 / SFF-8639 slot or bay.
EDSFF slot.
The slot has no lane splitting.
The slot has a bridge to share the lanes with associated devices.
The slot is bifurcated to split the lanes with associated devices.

The link to a switch that is associated with this PCIe device.
This property shall contain a link to a resource of type `Switch` that is associated with this PCIe device.

The CXL-specific properties of this PCIe device.
This property shall contain CXL-specific properties of this PCIe device.
The staged firmware version for this PCIe device; this firmware is not yet active.
This property shall contain the staged firmware version for this PCIe device; this firmware is not yet active.
The link to the collection of CXL logical devices within this PCIe device.
This property shall contain a link to a resource collection of type `CXLLogicalDeviceCollection`.
The CXL-specific properties of a PCIe device.
This type shall contain CXL-specific properties of a PCIe device.
The maximum number of logical devices supported by this CXL device.
This property shall contain the maximum number of logical devices supported by this CXL device.
Indicates whether the CXL device supports egress port congestion management.
This property shall indicate whether the CXL device supports the CXL Specification-defined 'Egress Port Congestion' mechanism.
Indicates whether the CXL device supports throughput reduction.
This property shall indicate whether the CXL device supports the CXL Specification-defined 'Throughput Reduction' mechanism.

PropertyValue.String: This property has been deprecated in favor of `TemporaryThroughputReductionSupported` to align with the CXL Specification-defined FMAPI command.

Annotation.String: The timestamp set on the CXL device.
This property shall contain the timestamp set on the CXL device.
The CXL device type.
This property shall contain the CXL device type.
A CXL Type 1 device.
This value shall indicate a CXL Specification-defined Type 1 device.
A CXL Type 2 device.
This value shall indicate a CXL Specification-defined Type 2 device.
A CXL Type 3 device.
This value shall indicate a CXL Specification-defined Type 3 device.

This version was created to correct various typographical errors. It was also created to correct the data type of the `MaxNumberLogicalDevices` property to only allow for integers.
This version was created to force the regeneration of OpenAPI schemas to properly express nullable properties with external references. It was also created to correct various typographical errors.
An indicator allowing an operator to physically locate this resource.
This property shall contain the state of the indicator used to physically identify or locate this resource.
An array of links to the processors that are directly connected or directly bridged to this PCIe device.
This property shall contain an array of links to resources of type `Processor` that represent processors that are directly connected or directly bridged to this PCIe device.
An indication of whether this PCIe slot supports hotplug.
This property shall indicate whether this PCIe slot supports hotplug.
The CXL dynamic capacity device (DCD) information for this CXL device.
This property shall contain the CXL dynamic capacity device (DCD) information for this CXL device.
The CXL dynamic capacity device (DCD) information for a CXL device.
This type shall contain the CXL dynamic capacity device (DCD) information for a CXL device.
The maximum number of hosts supported by this CXL device.
This property shall contain the maximum number of hosts supported by this CXL device.
The maximum number of dynamic capacity memory regions available per host from this CXL device.
This property shall contain the maximum number of dynamic capacity memory regions available per host from this CXL device.
The total memory media capacity of the CXL device available for dynamic assignment in mebibytes (MiB).
This property shall contain the total memory media capacity of the CXL device available for dynamic assignment in mebibytes (MiB).
The set of selection policies supported by the CXL device when dynamic capacity is added.
This property shall contain the CXL Specification-defined dynamic capacity policies that are supported by this CXL device when dynamic capacity is added.
The set of removal policies supported by the CXL device when dynamic capacity is released.
This property shall contain the CXL Specification-defined dynamic capacity policies that are supported by this CXL device when dynamic capacity is released.
The set of memory block sizes supported by memory regions in this CXL device.
This property shall contain the set of memory block sizes supported by memory regions in this CXL device.
An indication of whether the sanitization on capacity release is configurable for the memory regions in this CXL device.
This property shall indicate whether the sanitization on capacity release is configurable for the memory regions in this CXL device.
Set of memory block sizes supported by memory region in the CXL device.
This type shall contain the set of memory block sizes supported by memory region in the dynamic capacity device.
The memory region number.
This property shall contain the memory region number.
Set of memory block sizes supported by this memory region defined in mebibytes (MiB).
This property shall contain the set of memory block sizes supported by this memory region, with units in MiB.
An indication of whether the sanitization on capacity release is configurable for the memory region.
This property shall indicate whether the sanitization on capacity release is configurable for the memory region.
The memory region number.
This property shall contain the memory region number.
An indication of whether the sanitization on capacity release is configurable for this memory region.
This property shall indicate whether the sanitization on capacity release is configurable for this memory region.
Free add capacity policy.
This value shall indicate the CXL Specification-defined free add capacity policy.
Contiguous add capacity policy.
This value shall indicate the CXL Specification-defined contiguous add capacity policy.
Prescriptive add or release policy.
This value shall indicate the CXL Specification-defined prescriptive add or release policy.
Tag-based release policy.
This value shall indicate the CXL Specification-defined tag-based release policy.
This version was created to correct various typographical errors. It was also created to correct the data type of the `MaxNumberLogicalDevices` property to only allow for integers.
This version was created to force the regeneration of OpenAPI schemas to properly express nullable properties with external references. It was also created to correct various typographical errors.
The total number of PCIe unsupported requests received by this device.
This property shall contain the total number of PCIe unsupported requests received by this device.
This version was created to force the regeneration of OpenAPI schemas to properly express nullable properties with external references. It was also created to correct various typographical errors.
Indicates whether temporary throughput reduction is supported.
This property shall indicate whether the CXL Specification-defined 'Temporary Throughput Reduction' mechanism is supported on this device.
Indicates whether temporary throughput reduction is enabled.
This property shall indicate whether the CXL Specification-defined 'Temporary Throughput Reduction' mechanism is enabled on this device.
The total number of Bad TLPs issued on the PCIe link by the receiver.

This property shall contain the total number of Bad TLPs issued on the PCIe link by the receiver. A Bad TLP in the context of PCIe communication is a packet that cannot be properly processed due to errors at the transaction layer. These errors could include corrupted data, incorrect packet formatting, invalid header information, or a mismatched checksum.
The total number of Bad DLLPs issued on the PCIe link by the receiver.

This property shall contain the total number of Bad DLLPs issued on the PCIe link by the receiver. A Bad DLLP in the context of PCIe communication is a packet that has encountered errors at the data link layer. When a DLLP is considered bad, it means it has been corrupted or is incorrectly formatted, potentially due to transmission errors, hardware failures, or other issues that affect its integrity.
This version was created to add `Gen6` to `PCIeType` and `MaxPCIeType`.
This version was created to add `EDSFF` to `SlotType`.
The revision of the CXL specification in use by this device.
This property shall contain the negotiated CXL specification revision in use by this device.
An array of the CXL specification revisions supported by this device.
This property shall contain an array of the CXL specification revisions that this device supports.
CXL protocol specification revision 1.1.
CXL protocol specification revision 2.0.
CXL protocol specification revision 3.0.
CXL protocol specification revision 3.1.
CXL protocol specification revision 3.2.
